newsitem.title: UK: Hong Kong stocks firm in London as FTSE rebounds.
newsitem.headline: Hong Kong stocks firm in London as FTSE rebounds.

text.p: Hong Kong shares were generally firmer in London on Thursday as UK's FTSE 100 recouped most of its early losses, dealers said.
AT 1522 GMT, the Hang Seng London Reference Index was up 61.19 points to 14,567.68, led by gains in HSBC Holdings, which was up about HK$1.50 from the Hong Kong close, they said.
"The banks are stronger in general, but we're seeing most of the interest in Hong Kong bank (HSBC)," a dealer said.
In Hong Kong, the Hang Seng index jumped 302.60 points, or 2.13 percent, to 14,506.49.
